doc:
Marlene Willis https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marlene_Willis 0 Marlene Willis (January 13, 1942 - March 29, 1982) was an American actress, born in Harris County, Texas, who appeared mainly as a guest star in various narrative television series in the 1950s and '60s, such as The Andy Griffith Show (in the 12th episode, "Stranger in Town"); Maverick (in the 4th season episode entitled "Flood's Folly" with Roger Moore); Bourbon Street Beat; Wagon Train; Laramie; The Many Loves of Dobie Gillis; The Dick Powell Theatre; and The Loretta Young Show. She also appeared in the theatrical features Rockabilly Baby (1957) and Attack of the Puppet People (1958). Willis sang the theme song in addition to portraying a character in the latter film. Willis died of cancer at age 40 in 1982. Marlene_Willis ( January_13_,_1942 - March_29_,_1982 ) was an_American_actress , born in Harris_County , Texas , who appeared mainly as a_guest_star in various_narrative_television_series in the_1950s_and_'60s , such_as The_Andy_Griffith_Show ( in the_12th_episode , " Stranger in Town " ) ; Maverick ( in the_4th_season_episode entitled " Flood 's_Folly " with Roger_Moore ) ; Bourbon_Street_Beat ; Wagon_Train ; Laramie ; The_Many_Loves of Dobie_Gillis ; The_Dick_Powell_Theatre ; and The_Loretta_Young_Show . She also appeared in the_theatrical_features Rockabilly_Baby_(_1957_)_and_Attack of the_Puppet People (_1958_) . Willis sang the_theme_song in addition to portraying a_character in the_latter_film . Willis died of cancer at age_40 in 1982 .
